metadata.title: CVE-2022-21368 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Components Services). Supported versions that are affected are8.0.27 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedupdate, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data aswell as unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessibledata and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partialDOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.7 (Confidentiality, Integrityand Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-router - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
